meanings.definition: The quality of being threatening or foreshadowing evil or tragic developments.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds in the sky filled the town with a sense of ominousness.
meanings.sent2: The ominousness of the abandoned house made the children hesitant to approach.
meanings.sent3: Despite the ominousness of the situation, the detective couldn't help but crack a joke.
meanings.sent4: The ominousness of the silence in the forest was broken by a sudden rustling.
meanings.sent5: The ominousness of the storm approaching was palpable in the air.

meanings.definition: A feeling of foreboding or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the ominousness that lingered after watching the horror movie.
meanings.sent2: The ominousness in his voice made her worry about what was to come.
meanings.sent3: The ominousness of the dark alley was quickly dispelled by the appearance of a friendly cat.
meanings.sent4: The ominousness of the ticking clock added to her anxiety about finishing the test on time.
meanings.sent5: The ominousness of the unknown future weighed heavily on her mind.
